articles.description: Follow live text updates as Crystal Palace host Brighton in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to Crystal Palace v Brighton

articles.description: Uefa president Aleksander Ceferin says "football is not for sale" after plans for a revamped European Super League were announced.
articles.title: Football is not for sale - Uefa president Ceferin

articles.description: England and Sydney Sixers all-rounder Tom Curran receives a four-game ban in Australia's Big Bash League after being found guilty of intimidating an umpire.
articles.title: Tom Curran given BBL ban for intimidating umpire

articles.description: In 2014, Germany unleashed the power of numbers to help them to the World Cup title. Now, even the smallest teams have access to open-source data to arm them on the biggest stage.
articles.title: How World Cup underdogs thrived on data revolution

articles.description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says "anyone not in the right shape" to produce an atmosphere for Saturday's top-of-the-table match against Arsenal should "give their ticket somebody else".
articles.title: 'If you're not in right shape, give away your ticket' – Klopp

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola compares Club World Cup final opponents Fluminense's style of football with the great Brazilian teams of the 20th century.
articles.title: 'Like watching Brazil' - Guardiola on Fluminense test

articles.description: Joel Embiid scores more than 30 points and 10 rebounds in 12th straight game as the Philadelphia 76ers beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 127-113.
articles.title: NBA: Sixers' Joel Embiid with longest scoring run in 51 years

articles.description: In his BBC Sport column, George Groves previews Anthony Joshua and Deontay Wilder's fights in Saudi Arabia on Saturday and tries to pick a winner between the two.
articles.title: It's now or never for Joshua v Wilder - Groves

articles.description: All football has been suspended in Algeria after a bus crash on Wednesday killed a player and coach from Mouloudia Club El Bayadh.
articles.title: Bus crash in Algeria kills footballer and coach

articles.description: Luton Town captain Tom Lockyer is allowed to leave hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest on the pitch last weekend.
articles.title: Lockyer discharged from hospital after cardiac arrest
